intro: Pimpinella korshinskyi, commonly known as the Korshinsky's茴香, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is valued for its aromatic properties. The seeds are used in traditional medicine and as a spice in some cuisines.
